page.title: 06Nab Quarry
page.content: Nab quarry is a dead quarry used as a workplace for making fire places and for storage for the stone .The stone used comes from quarries in Yorkshire and Derbyshire .Different coloured stone is used-buff,pink and lilac also blue Welsh state ,green Cumbrian slate brown Cornish slate and marble from Italy , Portugal and Spain. The fire-place design is firstly agreed with a customer and then the stone is cut at the quarry.The stone is then fitted together like a jig saw puzzle but it is not cemented together until it is assembled in the customers home.On average it takes less than a day to build a fire place. . The four men that work at Nab Quarry can also build arches between room, small bridges , bars in public houses and frames for church windows.
